intro: Ornithogalum bourgaeanum, commonly known as the star of Bethlehem, is a perennial bulbous plant native to southern Africa. It features slender, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers with a star-like appearance. The plant belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped blooms that appear in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its striking appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
